Magnesium chloride solution BioUltra (2 M in H2O)

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ui81","text":"After all buffers are prepared, retrieve PDX/tumor samples or cells and thaw on ice. Add 1 tablet of Roche cOmplete™Protease Inhibitor Cocktail EASYpack per 50 mL of homogenization buffer. Vortex to dissolve tablet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":101,"length":51},{"style":"sup","offset":115,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9c43","text":"For cells, aim to have roughly 100 million.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":31,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87kqu","text":"For solid PDX tumor, aim to have between 250 and 350 milligrams.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aq4l8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6bjvk","text":"Resuspend each sample in 10 mL of HOMOGENIZATION BUFFER in a 50 mL conical and use an electric TissueRuptor® II (from Qiagen) to dissociate tumor chunks into a fully fluid and homogenous mixture with no particulate or remaining solid tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":34,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1e77a","text":"Keep samples on ice throughout!","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ehf6","text":"Be sure to autoclave the TissueRuptor stems before use and change stems between samples.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"61o93","text":"Retrieve a second 50 mL conical and pass the sample through an 18-gauge needle into the second conical at least once.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8p0fl","text":"If passaging in easy, move on to the next step. If syringe becomes clogged, further electric homogenization may be necessary.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5okbl","text":"Pass the sample through a 22-gauge needle between the first and second 50 mL conical 3 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16gds","text":"If sample becomes clogged in the 22-gauge syringe, further electric homogenization may be necessary.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39rg4","text":"Transfer fully homogenized samples to 15 mL conicals and centrifuge at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":71,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":77,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b3s4e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"1000","duration":0,"guid":"E8869FD08EF511EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"B5A076C08EF711EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"epquj","text":"Collect the supernatant, which is the Post-Nuclear Cytosol (PNC), in a new 15 mL conical.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"oc2n","text":"Keep samples on ice!!!","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"db02f","text":"Retrieve Beckman Coulter® Ultra-Clear Centrifuge Tubes, rotor (SW-41-Ti), sample holders, and necessary equipment for centrifugation. Add 2 mL of 60% sucrose as a cushion to the ultra-clear tubes slowly with a P-1000. Layer the first 2 mL of PNC supernatant from your samples on top of the 60% sucrose cushion VERY SLOWLY and carefully so as not to disturb the 60% gradient layer (can use a serological pipette).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":310,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46jif","text":"Samples running opposite of each other on the rotor should be balanced in their respective holders to the 100th decimal with homogenization buffer!","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":147},{"style":"sup","offset":109,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"g6c1","text":"Centrifuge samples at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":28,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"52a68","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"100000","duration":0,"guid":"816E7EB08EF711EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"A756A0808EF711EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"35p9a","text":"After centrifugation, use a serological pipette to carefully take out roughly 75% of the homogenization buffer supernatant making sure not to disturb the protein layer on top of the 60% cushion. Then using a P-200, harvest the Crude Plasma Membrane (CPM) fraction from the top of the 60% sucrose cushion and place in a new ultra-clear centrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":227,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6a4rn","text":"You can use a swirling technique with the P-200 to suck up the CPM fraction.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f96uv","text":"Try to minimalize the amount of 60% sucrose carry over when transferring the CPM fraction to new ultra tubes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f5pt7","text":"Using a P-1000, set the volume to 750 uL and add 1.5 mL of each sucrose gradient on top of the sample and each other VERY SLOWLY in a \"tear drop\" style fashion starting with 42.8% sucrose, then 42.3%, then 41.8%, then 41.0%, then 39.0%, and lastly 37.0% sucrose at the top.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":117,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cve2","text":"You can fill the rest of the tubes (SLOWLY) and balance opposite facing samples to the 100th decimal with 37% sucrose.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":6},{"style":"sup","offset":90,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jnv9","text":"It is VERY IMPORTANT to add your consecutive gradients slowly and steadily so as to have well-defined layer separation and prevent mixing of the gradients.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"287f0","text":"Centrifuge samples at   overnight for a minimum of  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9ks2o","text":"I would recommend setting the ultra-centrifuge to \"hold\" during this spin in case you are doing other experiments.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jes0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"100000","duration":0,"guid":"9A92E3208EF911EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":64800,"guid":"BBA1DE908EF911EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6am5","text":"The next day recover the Enriched Plasma Membrane (EPM) fraction from the top of the 37% sucrose cushion using a P-200 and place in a new ultra-clear centrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":25,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"em16k","text":"You can use a swirling technique with the P-200 to suck up the EPM fraction.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"caue2","text":"Retrieve as much of the EPM fraction on top of the 37% cushion as possible, while also limiting the amount of 37% sucrose carry-over, and place into new ultra-clear tubes. The key is to not get greedy!","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":87,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9geed","text":"Fill up the ultra-tubes with HEPES BUFFER and balance opposing tubes to the 100th decimal before spinning.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":29,"length":12},{"style":"sup","offset":79,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ag1v2","text":"Centrifuge samples at   for a minimum of  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":41,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ci2b9","text":"Sometimes you will have to centrifuge your samples anywhere between   and   during this step to guarantee total pellet sedimentation of the available EPM.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":68,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":74,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eghjp","text":"Would recommend starting with a 3-hour spin every time.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fug4f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"150000","duration":0,"guid":"8ED030208EFD11EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":9000,"guid":"A25375308EFD11EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":9000,"guid":"CBFEE0908EFD11EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":18000,"guid":"D4F705108EFD11EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f8r3l","text":"Decant the HEPES supernatant out of the ultra-clear tubes being careful not to disturb the protein pellet. Resuspend the pellet in 400 uL of DIGESTION BUFFER (10% SDC + 100 mM NH4HCO3) and vortex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":107,"length":50},{"style":"sub","offset":178,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":182,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4rih","text":"After resuspension with digestion buffer you can store your samples in  , however, it is ideal to complete the protocol up through the trypsin digestion.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":83,"length":69}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":71,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2doqr","text":"It would also be helpful to run a BCA Assay or other protein quantifications to determine the protein concentration per sample and determine how much trypsin to use for each sample.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ndev","text":"If pellets are not solvating into the digestion buffer well, you can sonicate the samples on ice for  .","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":101,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D22B6C808EFE11EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"A7BEB7808EFF11EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"caagc","text":"Retrieve Amicon® 0.5 mL Centrifugal Filter Units (for up to 10 KDa). Apply samples to the filter held in eppendorf tubes and spin down the samples between   and   for   at   to bind protein to the filter column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":155,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":161,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":167,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":172,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ne5r","text":"A small portion of liquid sample might remain at the bottom of the filter unit, but this is okay.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8a79r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"8000","duration":0,"guid":"2C1A62408F0011EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"12000","duration":0,"guid":"3E130FB08F0011EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"48573C308F0011EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"75B54F508F0011EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fk7ed","text":"Decant the flow-through waste from the collection tube and wash the filters with 400 uL of ddH2O by spinning samples down between   and   for   at  . Repeat this step a second time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":94,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":150,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":130,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":136,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":142,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":147,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1u9dk","text":"Again, a small portion of H2O might remain at the bottom of the filter unit, but this is okay.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":27,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jg17","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"8000","duration":0,"guid":"FE5078808F0011EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"12000","duration":0,"guid":"0520DB008F0111EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"0D2B92408F0111EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"15A29FE08F0111EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ns22","text":"Next, you want to perform a REDUCTION on your protein samples using a 5 mM Dithiothreitol (DTT) solution made in 50 mM NH4HCO3. Add 400 uL of the 5 mM DTT solution to each sample's filter unit and let incubate at room temperature for   for full reduction to occur. DO NOT SPIN DOWN AFTER.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":113,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":201,"length":33},{"style":"bold","offset":265,"length":22},{"style":"sub","offset":121,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":125,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":234,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"efao9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"DE3CB0808F0111EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1as6","text":"You now want to cap/block all the reduced sulfide bonds on the proteins by ALKYLATION with IODOACETAMIDE (IAA) in order to prevent DTT from reverse reacting and reforming disulfide bonds. You want a ratio of 4 IAA equivalents for every 1 DTT equivalent for full deactivation. Therefore, you will need a minimum of 20 mM of IAA to combat the 5 mM of DTT per sample. Using a stock solution of 0.5 M IAA (made with ddH2O), you will need roughly 16.67 uL of IAA per each 400 uL sample. Add directly to the filter units with a P-20 and INCUBATE IN THE DARK FOR   AT ROOM TEMPERATURE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":75,"length":35},{"style":"bold","offset":208,"length":44},{"style":"bold","offset":314,"length":49},{"style":"bold","offset":373,"length":27},{"style":"bold","offset":442,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":531,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":558,"length":19},{"style":"sub","offset":415,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":556,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a3d70","text":"0.5 M of IAA should be made fresh with ddH2O for every new experiment.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":42,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edvg5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"ADF7BF308F0311EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8bgcm","text":"After the incubation, spin down the samples at   for   and decant out the waste from the collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":47,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":53,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1tvdn","text":"You may have to spin the samples for up to   in order for the waste to fully pass through the column into the collection tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":43,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"31er4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"12000","duration":0,"guid":"2F307F108F0411EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"4C3D7A408F0411EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"8F8264F08F0411EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2aqqu","text":"After quantifying your total protein, make a 400 uL solution of 50 mM NH4HCO3 that includes the appropriate amount of TRYPSIN for each sample. A ratio of 1 ug of trypsin to 20 ug of protein is our standard ratio. Add the respective trypsin solutions to each sample and let the reaction sit overnight at room temperature for full peptide digestion.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":64,"length":14},{"style":"bold","offset":118,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":145,"length":44},{"style":"bold","offset":269,"length":77},{"style":"sub","offset":72,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":76,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jov4","text":"It would also be useful to test the pH of the samples after trypsin is added to make sure the solution is at a .. This is ideal for optimal enzymatic activity.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":111,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cdud2","text":"Some reagents require you to add TEAB to the trypsin before creating the 50 mM NH4HCO3 solutions for each sample. The trypsin used in the materials section does NOT require this.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":4},{"style":"sub","offset":81,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":85,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"ph","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"95AAF9408F0511EA8DD20B7BB8550316","id":0,"number":"8"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7a6cr","text":"Using a P-200, lightly resuspend the solution in the filter to make sure your peptides are mixed and detached from the column. Retrieve fresh centrifuge tubes and carefully tilt the sample in the filters upside-down into the new tubes. Centrifuge the upside-down filters in the new collection tubes at   for  . This ensures that the total amount of peptides fall into the new collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":302,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":308,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"feh0m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"12000","duration":0,"guid":"0AC0BA708FCA11EAA70B6D44ADEED4EB","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"1CB9DD108FCA11EAA70B6D44ADEED4EB","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ad13","text":"In order to promote peptide binding to the stage tips, use LC/MS-Grade TRIFLUOROACETIC ACID (TFA) to acidify your samples. Start by adding 3 uL - 5 uL of TFA to the samples inside a fume hood. You want to make sure the pH of your sample is  . Let the samples incubate on the bench at room temperature for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":41},{"style":"bold","offset":59,"length":38},{"style":"bold","offset":259,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":240,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":305,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"23npt","text":"TFA is highly corrosive and will burn your skin. Handle with care IN A FUME HOOD.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hogi","text":"TFA also deactivates the trypsin by quenching the reaction as well as pulling the SDC out of the sample solution as a precipitate.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73ua7","text":"While the samples sit for 30 minutes, you can begin STAGE TIPPING with CARBON-18 RESIN for your samples.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":52,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfe8t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"ph","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B01E68508FCA11EAA70B6D44ADEED4EB","id":0,"number":"2"}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"DA4397908FCA11EAA70B6D44ADEED4EB","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2k4im","text":"Spin down the samples after the incubation at maximum speed for   at  . While this occurs you can continue to STAGE TIP with C-18 RESIN. About 4-6 punches of the resin per sample are optimal to pack a P-200 pipette tip. Using pipette tip holders, or ADAPTERS, you can place the tips in fresh eppendorf tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":46,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":110,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":250,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":69,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7u9mm","text":"Punches are easily made using P-1000 pipette tips that have the tip-ends snipped around half an inch.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cl87","text":"The C-18 resin helps to cleanse the sample of excess salt and contaminants.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egtjn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"CD9CB1008FCC11EAA70B6D44ADEED4EB","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D294F8208FCC11EAA70B6D44ADEED4EB","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fi20","text":"Finally, elute your samples into fresh eppendorf tubes by using 100 uL of 70% Acetonitrile and centrifuging them at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":64,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":116,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":122,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7s8u0","text":"    The samples will be put into the speed vacuum next, so it is okay if they start to dry out.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5877","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"1500","duration":0,"guid":"5D7F10A0947E11EA86BB79FA302BB2DD","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"8944D080947E11EA86BB79FA302BB2DD","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
